title: Resource exhausted
body:
Hello,
I would like to know if I made  a mistake using your library
I want to do a TCN that does from an array of ~43000 to an output of ~100 to an hidden layers, then several outputs (regression problem. For this example I wanted to use only one output to see if everything was ok). However I get Ressource exhausted, But I feel like it is weird since the number of parameters should decrease exponentially with the layers, and therefore not be too substantial

My network is:
```
from tensorflow.keras import Input, Model
from tensorflow.keras.models import Sequential
from tensorflow.keras.layers import Dense
from tcn import TCN

model = Sequential()
model.add(TCN(nb_filters=100, dilations=dilations,nb_stacks=nb_stacks, return_sequences=False))
model.add(Dense(100))
model.add(Dense(1))

model.compile(optimizer='adam', loss='mse', metrics=['accuracy'])
```

kernel_size:  2
For the dilations I tried several things by either adding more dilations or more stacks
stacks = 4 and dilations = [1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096]
or
stacks = 1 and dilations = [1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 16384]

error:
```
(0) Resource exhausted: OOM when allocating tensor with shape[1,45248,100] and type float on /job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/device:GPU:0 by allocator GPU_0_bfc
	 [[{{node sequential/tcn/residual_block_11_1/conv1D_0/Pad}}]]
```

Do you see something weird ? 
Or Am I just pushing the numbers too much ?
It bothers me because it was working quite well with pytorch, but for some reason I need to migrate my project to TF/Keras

Thanks !
